result.execSummary:
The defendant George N Pappas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid by 02-05-2016 or 2 years driver license suspension as penalty for non-payment of fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George N Pappas

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant George N Pappas in court.  

State moves to orally amend the charge to a State DC 947.01(1).
Defendant has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $442
To be paid in full by:  02/05/16
Alternate:  DL Suspension.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant George N Pappas in court.   
Defendant waiting on response from the State on his counteroffer.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant George N Pappas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant states he is representing himself and has provided the State a counter-offer.
Court sets matter over for the State to review offer.  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or operator of the other vehicle listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant George N Pappas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
